case_title: MUHAMMAD ZAMAN and 4 others vs SIKANDAR KHAN and 5 others
complaint_summary: The respondents sought redemption of mortgaged land originally mortgaged in 1880. The appellants contested the claim, arguing that the limitation period had expired.
investigation_summary: The Assistant Commissioner/Collector allowed the redemption application in 1988, which was upheld by the Additional Commissioner in 1989. The appellants argued that the limitation period started from the original mortgage date in 1880, not the redemption date in 1930.
judgment_summary: The court accepted the appeal, setting aside the orders of the Collector and Additional Commissioner. It ruled that the limitation period started from the original mortgage date in 1880, extinguishing the respondents' ownership rights and vesting them in the appellants.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeal accepted; ownership rights of respondents extinguished and vested in appellants.
legal_arguments: Limitation period starts from original mortgage date (14-8-1880).
Doctrine of subrogation under sections 92 and 95 of the Transfer of Property Act.
No acknowledgment of liability under section 19 of the Limitation Act.
Limitation for redemption under Article 148 of the Limitation Act is 60 years.
Principle of extinctive prescription under section 28 of the Limitation Act.

assets.description: Land bearing Khasra Nos. 136, 765, 203, 204, and 207 measuring 29 Kanals-8 marlas.
assets.location: Village Khanna Kak, Tehsil and District Rawalpindi

statutes: Redemption and Restitution of Mortgage Lands Act, 1964
sections: Section 14(2) of Redemption and Restitution of Mortgage Lands Act, 1964
Sections 92 and 95 of Transfer of Property Act, 1882
key_issues: Determination of limitation period for redemption of mortgaged land.
Effect of acknowledgment of liability under section 19 of Limitation Act.

maxims.Subrogation: A co-mortgagor redeeming the whole mortgage replaces the original mortgagee in respect of the shares of other co-mortgagors.

legal_terms.Redemption: The act of reclaiming mortgaged property by paying off the debt.
legal_terms.Subrogation: The substitution of one party for another with respect to legal rights.

words_and_phrases.Limitation Period: The time frame within which legal action must be initiated.
words_and_phrases.Extinctive Prescription: The principle under which rights are extinguished after the expiration of a limitation period.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the redemption of mortgaged land and the determination of the limitation period. The court ruled in favor of the appellants, holding that the limitation period started from the original mortgage date in 1880, extinguishing the respondents' ownership rights.
